actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Mr. Graves (MO) asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, July 20, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 11:00 a.m. on Monday, July 24, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 3935.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 364).
The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 3935.
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 363).
On agreeing to the Perry amendment; Failed by recorded vote: (Roll no. 362).
On agreeing to the Graves (MO) amendments Agreed to by recorded vote: (Roll no. 361).

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 77, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Larsen (WA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 597, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 77.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 77 printed in Part A of House Report 118-147 to strike the telework provisions in the underlying bill and apply the SHOW UP Act telework restrictions to the FAA.

At the conclusion of debate on the Perry amendment No. 76, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Graves (MO) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 597, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Perry amendment No. 76.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Perry,  numbered 76 printed in Part A of House Report 118-147 to strike sections 206 and 207 relating to N number restrictions.

At the conclusion of debate on the Graves (MO) amendment en bloc No. 4, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Larsen (WA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 597, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on the Graves (MO) amendment en bloc No. 4.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Graves (MO),  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-147 as en bloc No. 4: Nos. 60, 61, 85, 87, 88, 89, 90, 91, 92, 93, 94, 99, 100, 101, 102, 103, and 104.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3935 â€” "To amend title 49, United States Code, to reauthorize and improve the Federal Aviation Administration and other civil aviation programs, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 minutes per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Caraveo to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. Dr. J. Henry Buck, Jr., Grace Baptist Church of Germantown, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
